Description: Neck and shoulder fragment of Attic black-figured pottery neck-amphora. Tongues at top of shoulder; on the neck, palmette and lotus band; added red on the central petal of the lotus, on alternate tongues, and on the necking ring.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 74, no. 245 pl. 54)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0867)
